Description: Mould-made head of a lion in glazed composition; small hole pierced in the middle of the head to attach it to or hang it from something; remains of turquoise glaze; lower part and ears missing.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by The Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See another example of lion head from Naukratis: Cairo, Egyptian Museum JE36251.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ON.07)
